content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory at Position(2.5, 17.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Factory burner inserter at Position(2.5, 16.5) (retrieved in Step 210)
– Dedicated burner inserter at Position(3.5, 17.5) placed at the factory interface (Step 211)
– Cable factory input chest at Position(2.5, 17.5) that serves as the input storage
– Assembling machine at Position(1.5, 19.5) that processes copper plates into copper cables

### Extraction System at Position(–3.5, 27.5)
Consists of the following entity:
– Extraction system burner inserter at Position(–3.5, 27.5) with drop position at (–3.5, 28.5)
This system is used for extracting and transferring copper plates from the source.

### Belt Depot for Extraction System at Position(3.5, 15.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Wooden chest (belt depot) at Position(3.5, 15.5) crafted and placed to serve as an isolated belt target (Step 214)
– Dedicated transport belt segment at Position(4.5, 15.5) placed adjacent to the depot chest (Step 215)
– Depot burner inserter at Position(3.5, 14.5) using direction UP, with a pickup position at (3.5, 15.5) and drop position at (3.5, 13.5) (Step 216)
This assembly is intended to receive items from the extraction system and feed them into downstream processes.

ERROR TIPS
────────────
• Connection Target Error (Steps 210, 211, 213, 214, 215, 216, 217)
  – Repeated errors report: “Transport belts cannot be connected directly to a Prototype.SteamEngine object as a target. You need to add an inserter that inputs items into Prototype.SteamEngine and use the inserter as the target entity.”
  – Tip: Before connecting transport belts, ensure that the target entity is an inserter (or another valid connector) rather than a steam engine.

• Placement Range Error (Step 212)
  – When attempting to place a wooden chest at (3.5,15.5), an error indicates that the target position is too far from the player’s current position.
  – Tip: Move closer to the intended target position to satisfy the maximum placement distance.

• Undefined Variable Error (Step 212)
  – An error shows “NameError: name 'target_chest' is not defined” suggesting mistaken or missing variable naming.
  – Tip: Verify that all variable names are correctly defined and referenced before use.

• Inventory Shortage Error (Step 213)
  – An error occurs when placing a wooden chest due to none being available in the inventory.
  – Tip: Confirm the inventory contains the required item or craft it before attempting placement.
